sentences.content: Key Message
Harbour porpoise distribution shifted southward within the Greater North Sea.
Abundance appears stable
except for a decline in the Irish and Celtic Seas.
Assessed populations of coastal bottlenose dolphin appear
Conclusion (brief)
Cetaceans are widely distributed in a range of habitats and are overall abundant throughout the OSPA...
Maritime Area.
For most species there are less than two comparable estimates of abundance and a robust
trend assessment is not possible.
Conclusion (extended)
In the Greater North Sea subregion, only harbour porpoise, white-beaked dolphin and minke whale have
more than two estimates of abundance, but there is no evidence that numbers have declined (or increa...
since 1994.
However, only for the harbour porpoise does this subregion maps to a species’ AU.
